intro: Windmannia cochabambensis, commonly known as the Cochabamba windmannia, is a flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
